I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
b: R
a: R
n: nat

Goal:
unif_part a b (S n) = a :: unif_part ((a * INR (S n) + b) / INR (S (S n))) b n

Premises:
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat For S: Argument scope is [nat_scope]
INR = fix INR (n : nat) : R := match n with | 0%nat => 0 | 1%nat => 1 | S (S _ as n0) => INR n0 + 1 end : nat -> R Argument scope is [nat_scope]
unif_part = fun (a b : R) (n : nat) => mkseq (fun i : nat => a + INR i * (b - a) / (INR n + 1)) (S (S n)) : R -> R -> nat -> seq R Argument scopes are [R_scope R_scope nat_scope]
maxN : forall (a b : R) (del : posreal), a < b -> {n : nat | a + INR n * del < b <= a + INR (S n) * del}
unif_part_nat : forall (a b : R) (n : nat) (x : R), a <= x <= b -> {i : nat | nth 0 (unif_part a b n) i <= x < nth 0 (unif_part a b n) (S i) /\ (S (S i) < size (unif_part a b n))%nat} + {nth 0 (unif_part a b n) n <= x <= nth 0 (unif_part a b n) (S n)}
tech_pow_Rplus : forall (x : R) (a n : nat), x ^ a + INR n * x ^ a = INR (S n) * x ^ a
unif_part_bound : forall (a b : R) (n : nat), unif_part a b n = rev (unif_part b a n)
S_INR : forall n : nat, INR (S n) = INR n + 1
Rabs_div : forall a b : R, b <> 0 -> Rabs (a / b) = Rabs a / Rabs b
seq_step_unif_part : forall (a b : R) (n : nat), seq_step (unif_part a b n) = Rabs ((b - a) / (INR n + 1))
Rabs_triang : forall a b : R, Rabs (a + b) <= Rabs a + Rabs b
last_unif_part : forall (x0 a b : R) (n : nat), last x0 (unif_part a b n) = b
head_unif_part : forall (x0 a b : R) (n : nat), head x0 (unif_part a b n) = a
unif_part_sort : forall (a b : R) (n : nat), a <= b -> sorted Rle (unif_part a b n)
Rlt_div_l : forall a b c : R, c > 0 -> a / c < b < -> a < b * c
NewtonInt_P5 : forall (f g : R -> R) (l a b : R), Newton_integrable f a b -> Newton_integrable g a b -> Newton_integrable (fun x : R => l * f x + g x) a b
nth_rev : forall (T : Type) (x0 : T) (n : nat) (s : seq T), ssrnat.leq (S n) (size s) -> nth x0 (rev s) n = nth x0 s (ssrnat.subn (size s) (S n))
seq_step_unif_part_ex : forall (a b : R) (eps : posreal), {n : nat | seq_step (unif_part a b n) < eps}
INR_IZR_INZ : forall n : nat, INR n = IZR (Z.of_nat n)
Rminus_le_0 : forall a b : R, a <= b < -> 0 <= b - a
Un_growing = fun Un : nat -> R => forall n : nat, Un n <= Un (S n) : (nat -> R) -> Prop Argument scope is [function_scope]
tech5 : forall (An : nat -> R) (N : nat), sum_f_R0 An (S N) = sum_f_R0 An N + An (S N)
Alembert_C1 : forall An : nat -> R, (forall n : nat, 0 < An n) -> Un_cv (fun n : nat => Rabs (An (S n) / An n)) 0 -> {l : R | Un_cv (fun N : nat => sum_f_R0 An N) l}
plus_INR : forall n m : nat, INR (n + m) = INR n + INR m
max_N : forall a b : R, posreal -> a < b -> nat
nth_mkseq : forall (T : Type) (x0 : T) (f : nat -> T) (n i : nat), ssrnat.leq (S i) n -> nth x0 (mkseq f n) i = f i
Alembert_C2 : forall An : nat -> R, (forall n : nat, An n <> 0) -> Un_cv (fun n : nat => Rabs (An (S n) / An n)) 0 -> {l : R | Un_cv (fun N : nat => sum_f_R0 An N) l}
BinNatDef.N.div_eucl = fun a b : N => match a with | 0%N => (0%N, 0%N) | N.pos na => match b with | 0%N => (0%N, a) | N.pos _ => BinNatDef.N.pos_div_eucl na b end end : N -> N -> N * N Argument scopes are [N_scope N_scope]
